phrases: Forever learning, always building. This is where my journey as a developer begins.
Building both sides of the web one backend route and one frontend component at a time.
Learning to build the professional webs, to become better.
Still a learner, but already solving problems from backend to frontend.
Self-taught, still in progress but already building what I used to only imagine.
Learning to think full stack, falling in love with Node, React and Deploy along the way.

about.title: Passionate developer building functional, clean and modern web apps
about.1paragraph: With experience in both backend and frontend development, I enjoy turning complex problems into simple, scalable solutions. From designing RESTful APIs with Node.js and Express to creating elegant interfaces with React and TailwindCSS, I strive to build products that are fast, accessible, and user-friendly.
about.2paragraph: I'm passionate about continuous learning, collaboration, and delivering high-quality code. Currently focused on mastering advanced JavaScript, full-stack architecture, and deployment on cloud platforms like AWS or using tools like Vercel. I love what I do and I’m always looking for new challenges to grow as a developer.

services.webDevDesc: Creating modern websites and web apps using modern tools
services.uiuxDesc: Designing intuitive and inclusive user experiences focused on usability and clarity
services.teamDesc: Working in agile teams, applying Git and GitHub for efficient collaboration

bananaPeels.title: BananaPeels, buy or sell your furniture.
bananaPeels.description: BananaPeels is a second-hand marketplace web platform where users can securely post, browse, and manage ads quickly and easily.

men-api-scaffold.title: NPM package
men-api-scaffold.description: A lightweight and functional scaffold for building APIs using the MEN architecture (MongoDB - Express - Node.js), designed for those who want to get started quickly with a clean and solid foundation.

calculator.title: Calculator
calculator.description: It is a mini project in order to practicing vanilla JS and HTML/CSS
